attributes.action: Abolish the Palace of Westminster restaurant subsidy for those earning over £23K
attributes.background: In 2016, the food/drink subsidy in Parliament cost around £3.7M. This use of taxpayers’ money must stop for higher earners, with funds diverted to public services where it is needed. Citizens who themselves struggle to buy food should not be forced to help feed MPs who earn significant wages.

attributes.action: Utility companies to be responsible for repairing potholes around poor repairs
attributes.background: A majority of potholes form around places of existing weakness, such as road repair works following companies digging up the roads for routine maintenance.  These companies should be responsible for filling any potholes that are a consequence of a road weakness following their actions
attributes.additional_details:
Potholes are caused when water penetrates cracks in the road. When this water freezes, it expands, widening the cracks. When it melts, traffic smashes new craters into the road surface.  Other countries do not have many drains and services under their roads, and do not give privatised utility companies the right to dig up a new road
An increasing number of road users are taking legal action. The AA estimates that the cost to insurers of claims (pothole damage) was £2.85m during February alone.

attributes.action: Male & Female employees should be treated the same when on shared parental leave
attributes.background:
Because of the Equality Act 2010 woman and men should have the same company benefits as equal pay.
At the moment companies can offer a enhanced maternity pay that benefits only women can opt not to offer the same benefits to male employees wanting to take Shared Paternal Leave.
attributes.additional_details:
At the moment there isn't any legal requirement, with some cases people making a claim that they are being treated less favourable than women on the same company and/or job, some being successful and some not.
Some companies use the technicality that male employee on shared parental leave is treated no less favourably than a female employee on shared parental leave while they offer enhaced maternity pay a benefit only available to womans.

attributes.action: Ban plastic cotton buds
attributes.background: The sale and manufacture of plastic-stemmed cotton buds is to be banned under new Scottish government plans. England should follow suit as the plastic stems of cotton buds kill 1000s of marine species every year along the coastline.
attributes.additional_details: If the Scottish government can take action and ban plastic being used to make cotton buds so can we. People flush plastic cotton buds down the toilet and many end up in the ocean and as a result they are washed up on our beaches. Not only is this devastating for ecosystems but also for the health of our beautiful coastline. With alternatives such as paper cotton buds available, there is really no need to use plastic.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to purposely waste ambulance time & resources.
attributes.background:
Recently an ambulance service rushed to attend to a man claiming to have had a stroke, only to find out he made it up so he could get a free lift. 

Unfortunately the service has said it has to deal with ‘day in day out’ and that unfortunately there is no law against wasting ambulance time.

attributes.action: Make typing and full keyboard skills a compulsory part of secondary education.
attributes.background:
Children today are having to do much of their education online and on computers.  Yet they are not taught to type properly.  This leads to slow work and frustration.  
We do not give a child a pencil and expect them to learn to write. Yet we give them a keyboard and expect them to learn to type.

attributes.action: Prohibit filibustering and similar forms of sabotage to the democratic process.
attributes.background: Certain MPs have been subverting democracy by using filibustering and other procedural technicalities to prevent reasoned intellectual debate of bills in the House of Commons. This is an affront to the parliamentary process and brings our country’s politics into disrepute.

attributes.action: Change 30 free hour childcare to a monthly sign-up and not a term sign-up.
attributes.background: Parents who get a full time job need to then put their child into care immediately, so need the support immediately and not on a term by term basis, you can't sign up when you don't have a job but when you do, you have to wait until the new term starts. If this was monthly it would make sense.

attributes.action: Compulsory mental health education in school.
attributes.background: We need to promote good mental health practices in the same way we promote good physical health.

attributes.action: Pass a law requiring NHS Trusts to release patient records within 21 days
attributes.background: Currently, there are significant variations between NHS trusts as to how long they will take to release patient records when requested. We, the undersigned, call on the government to standardise this in law to 21 days, as for many people accessing their medical records is potentially time critical

attributes.action: Ban snares because animals suffer terrible injuries and deaths
attributes.background: Snares are compared to landmines for the indiscriminate way in which these wire traps capture a wide range of animals – from foxes to family pets to protected species. A snare is an archaic thin metal wire noose intended to catch animals by lassoing and trapping them.
attributes.additional_details:
Snares are mainly set on shooting estates to stop foxes from catching the 'game' birds. Britain is one of the few European countries where so-called free-running snares are still used and most countries have banned them. 
The Government believes that snare use can be controlled by a Code of Practice - but this is impossibly to enforce! 
One council has banned snares to protect British wildlife - https://www.league.org.uk/news/council-bans-snares-to-protect-british-wildlife.

attributes.action: Ensure money raised from new sugar levy is divided between education and the NHS
attributes.background:
The Government recently introduced the sugar levy on soft drinks to try and tackle the growing problem of obesity in the UK. The legislation doesn’t specify where the money raised should be spent.
We would like legislation created to ensure that any money raised is given to the NHS and to education
attributes.additional_details: The levy on soft drinks is expected to raise over £274 million pounds which could be used to help fund the struggling NHS budget and also fund sport activities for school children.

attributes.action: Introduce a new system to ensure that roads are maintained to a safe standard.
attributes.background: Despite a legal requirement for roads to be maintained to a safe standard, highway authorities have been allowed to put lives at risk by letting many roads become unsafe. Urgent action is needed now to remedy this and a new system needed to prevent this from happening in the future.
attributes.additional_details: Legislation and guidance on road maintenance lie with the Highways Act 1980 and the Well-Maintained Highways: Code of Practice, respectively. Both these require that roads should be maintained in a safe condition but this is clearly not happening. Individuals can go through the process of suing for damage or injury but this has proved inadequate in preventing roads being allowed to deteriorate into a dangerous state. There is a clear lack of accountability and an absence of desire on behalf of the government to implement the requirements of existing legislation and guidance. A new system is therefore required to ensure that safe standards are set and that these standards are met.

attributes.action: Ban exams, instead get graded for classwork.
attributes.background: Because many people have anxiety, and this would help them from getting through this. Usually children to much better in class than under exam conditions.

attributes.action: ban homework
attributes.background:
i don't like homework, students don't like homework, teachers don't like homework, so why is homework a thing? we don't need it, so lets get rid of it!
it prevents social building of students, and increases the workload heavily on teachers. homework is bad for everyone, the recipient, and producer.
attributes.additional_details: i hate homework, so let's get rid of it

attributes.action: Post on Motorway message boards to remind middle lane 'Hoggers' to Pull Over
attributes.background:
Every driver has experienced being in a long tail back as one lorry slowly edges past another. 

Drivers can now be given 3 points for not pulling back into the Left-hand lane but this is not enforced. 

Why not use the Electronic signs to remind drivers to use the left to improve traffic flow?

attributes.action: Make Mental Health services exempt from VAT.
attributes.background: Mental Health services such as Addiction Counselling (Food, Drugs, Alcohol etc), Psychotherapy and Trauma Counselling currently are all deemed as VATable expenses which makes them a “Luxury Item” this means that Thousands of people are having to pay extra for the help they desperately need!
attributes.additional_details: Currently services such as Equine Therapy, Art Therapy and Speech Therapy are all VAT Exempt so why not important potentially life saving/ changing services? If this government is serious about helping people with mental health issues then drop the VAT and help to make the services they need more affordable.

attributes.action: Serious injuries caused by careless driving should lead to imprisonment.
attributes.background: People's lives are completely changed for the worst due to drivers lack of care on the road. Victims of this often result there pain in suicide, leaving a large strain on not only the victims' lives but the people around them.
attributes.additional_details: Drivers do not deserve to walk away freely from the pain they have caused.

attributes.action: Mental health services to become accessible  24/7 including help line funding
attributes.background: After suffering from mental health issues and also close family members I realised that unless you are in a mental health crisis between the hours of 9 - 4.30 Monday to Friday help is few and far between unless you contact 999. The government need to fund help lines with trained professionals.
attributes.additional_details: There are at least 10 different help lines out of these 10 there are only 2 open out of hours . One of these is only voluntary based not professional help and the other is professional led but is so over run with people needing there help they can't keep up . There are millions of people suffering ,the suicide rate is higher than ever with a vast majority of these happening " out of hours" ie weekends evening and nights more needs to be done to take this seriously so that this doesn't happen to another loved one

attributes.action: Stop the Experimental Closures on the byways & Droves near Stonehenge
attributes.background:
The public have had access from the A303 & Larkhill to park up and walk around the landscape of our acient Stonehenge free of charge, 24/7. It's the only safe place to visitors can stay free.
We object the refusal of motorized vehicals on the byways that have been used freely for various reasons.
attributes.additional_details:
English Heritage do not provide free 24/7 parking near Stonehenge to view on the free permissive path. 
The reasons for Closure need to be further debated with the public involved who wish to use the byways as usual. 
The report on objections made by the public are going into a report that is not independent from the Government officials and highways

attributes.action: Add teaching of CPR and basic lifesaving skills to the teaching syllabus
attributes.background: Many lives could potentially be saved if more individuals within the U.K. knew how to correctly carry out CPR and had the knowledge of basic lifesaving skills. Include these topics in the primary & secondary national curriculum to save thousands of lives.

attributes.action: Give English constituencies a referendum on creating an English Parliament
attributes.background: Voters in English constituencies want the creation of a secular single chamber English Parliament elected separately from Westminster and located outside of London. This will address the democratic deficit experienced by English voters and give us English votes for English laws.

attributes.action: Cap council tax at 2% per annum maximum from 2019 onwards
attributes.background:
Many pensioners and early retirees have fixed incomes (annuity pensions).
The last two years have seen an 11% increase in council tax which is proving increasingly difficult to pay.

attributes.action: Remove Chris Brown’s ban from the U.K. and allow him access to the country.
attributes.background: Global sensation and pop-culture figure, Chris Brown was publicly banned from entering the United Kingdom in 2009 following his domestic abuse and violent history towards then girlfriend, Rihanna. I believe that the ban should be lifted almost 10 years on so Brown can come and perform in the U.K.
attributes.additional_details: My knowledge from the Daily Mail and love for Chris Brown are my references.

attributes.action: Amend the knife law: Ban drop point blades and thumb studs.
attributes.background: Knife crime is a serious problem in our nation. Drop and clip point blades (blades with a point designed to achieve greater penetration when used to stab) and thumb studs (nubs of metal that allow a knife to be rapidly opened with one hand) should be banned to reduce the severity of knife attacks.
attributes.additional_details:
Current knife law is designed around preventing stabbings and keeping our streets safe. (https://www.gov.uk/buying-carrying-knives) Drop and clip point knives are not restricted under this law. These knife types are designed to cause worse stab wounds. (https://www.knife-depot.com/knife-information-105.html, https://www.knife-depot.com/knife-information-104.html)
Thumb studs (also legal) convert knives into switchblades in all but name. (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-zCMe1q8MY8)

attributes.action: Help me to deport my little brother from a Singaporean prison back to the UK
attributes.background: In the November of 2016 19 year old Lorenzo Dentamaro, was arrested in Singapore on accusations of fraud. He spent 6 months on bail battling the case only to be made an example of and harshly served with 3 years inprisomment. He is currently in 16 man cell, suffering in 30 plus temperatures.
attributes.additional_details: My family is suffering, I have grandparents that are very old and may never have the opportunity to see him again. We have to travel 13 hours to see him for only 20 minutes and I just want to bring him back home so he can complete his sentence in the UK. My mother is depressed, our lives have been impacted serverely and I am constantly living on breaking point. I just want to bring him home.

attributes.action: Change the law to make the sex offenders register public
attributes.background: Every few months we hear of another sex offender who’s been living in our area beside our kids and schools, our children are not safe to walk to school or play with friends because they keep them protected and not the people at real risk

attributes.action: Include courses on the awareness of terminal illnesses in schools
attributes.background: Include courses in the PSHE curriculum to teach children about terminal illnesses in our schools, and how to deal with them.
attributes.additional_details: Many children do not know how to react to and deal with a family member, friend, or themselves being diagnosed with terminal illnesses such as cancer.

attributes.action: Recoup NHS treatment costs from anyone convicted of domestic violence offences.
attributes.background: My plan would be to use the U.K. Courts system to recoup the costs of treating domestic violence victims by applying an additional financial penalty (to anyone convicted of domestic violence) that fully covers the costs of any NHS treatment that arises as a result of a person’s criminal act.
attributes.additional_details:
Every year, it is estimated, that it costs the NHS approximately £5.5 billions Sterling to treat victims of domestic violence.Please See link below.
https://www.trustforlondon.org.uk/news/domestic-violence-costs-55bn-year-england/
Surely these NHS treatment costs could be recouped from anyone convicted of an offence of domestic violence or abuse by using the U.K Law Courts to apply an additional financial penalty to perpetrators of domestic violence offences?

attributes.action: Allow working parents free childcare ALL YEAR up to the age of 10.
attributes.background: Working a full time job and having children is hard!  Reagrdless of whether you are single or a couple. The general work place gives 23ish days holiday while children are given 11 weeks,  with no family network to rely on childcare is very costly, almost to the point of it not being worth working.
attributes.additional_details:
You feel guilty if you do work and guilty if you dont! If you want us to work and input into society, help us!
It would be easier to go on benfits and watch my children grow up. 
Help is really needed here! So many people are working just to pay for childcare not to mention how many must be left alone.
Let us have a quality of life with our children.

attributes.action: Abolish inheritance tax
attributes.background:
It is wrong to tax assets that have already been taxed
We believe that Inheritance Tax should be abolished. It is a tax on assets that have already been taxed. 
People should be free to leave their assets to whomsoever they want without fear of being taxed again.

attributes.action: Make UK standard parking spaces bigger.
attributes.background: Parking space is a premium in most cities and towns. However, most spaces are barely wider than a vehicle. A UK standard parking space is 2.4m wide, by 4.8m. The average family car is 2.1m x 4.8m. Park perfectly and you get 150mm either side to open a door. This is not enough for most vehicle users.
attributes.additional_details:
You should be able to park your vehicle and get in or out without struggling. You should also not have to worry about potential damage which can often be sustained in your absence. Causing needless cost and loss of earnings, maybe even insurance hikes. Town and city planners have overlooked this for years, as have Supermarkets and retail parks.
It's time, as consumers, that we took a stand and put the onus onto those profiting from our misery.
Your vote could help to change this.

attributes.action: Abolish school uniform in all schools.
attributes.background: School uniform rules have recently become too strict, to the point where people are being suspended from school for their appearance. We preach about not missing education yet we stop it over cloth and dye? Teenagers should express themselves and not be punished for being unique.
attributes.additional_details: When a student has done something particularly bad like get into a fight or bully another student we suspend them or put them in isolation to punish the student. Why is a student with blue hair or with a t-shirt being punished at the same level? We encourage students to 'be themselves' yet we confine this with rules. Teenagers already struggle in schools with exams, hormones, sexuality etc. We shouldn't be giving them more reasons to stress out. Casual dress-code doesn't stop them learning.

attributes.action: The People's Mandate. Electorate vote on the agenda of next parliament.
attributes.background: Give the electorate a preliminary vote in the year before each General Election, that will allow them to choose the agenda of the next parliament & provide the political parties with a 'people's mandate' by which they design their manifestos to serve. For too long the word 'Mandate' has been abused.
attributes.additional_details: This 'Preliminary Vote' could be in the form of a list of government departments or pressing issues that the country faces. The electorate would vote on their top 3 priorities and this would be collated to provide the future government with a democratic mandate from which to form their manifestos. To date, the people get what they are given. With a preliminary vote on issues of importance the people get to be more involved in driving the political policy of the next parliament.

attributes.action: "Warning" labels on dog flea shampoos containing Pyrethrum as toxic to cats.
attributes.background: I washed my cat with dog flea shampoo. There was no warning label on the product. In small writing amongst other text it stated it should never be used on cats. Unfortunately, my beloved companion died 2 days later. This type of poisoning is not uncommon.
attributes.additional_details: The product I used was a standard dog flea shampoo purchased over the counter for my dog weeks beforehand, but I didn't think it would be harmful to my cat.  Clear, informed "Warning" labels should be on the front of such products indicating they are toxic to cats. This will hopefully prevent other cats from being harmed or dying as a result of the chemical Pyrethrum which they can't metabolise, yet dogs can.

attributes.action: Bring forward the 2020 London Mayoral Elections to 2019.
attributes.background: The 2020 London mayoral elections should be brought forward from 2020 to 2019 in order to de-conflict with a possible general election also due 2020.
attributes.additional_details:
The current London assembly is running with the idea that the election should be delayed until 2021 because of the chance of a general election in the same year (2020). This will give the current mayor an extra 12 months in power without being re-elected.

Londoners should be given the opportunity to select a new mayor sooner rather than later. The people of London must be given the chance to rid themselves of the massive increase in crime associated with the current mayor.

attributes.action: Allow women to breastfeed anywhere in the House of Commons
attributes.background: In the chamber of the House of Commons, women cannot breastfeed. The law allows women to breastfeed anywhere, so the House of Commons should be no exception - it's a bad example when the UK has low breastfeeding rates. It discriminates against MPs who breastfeed and against their constituents.

attributes.action: Urge Iceland to stop killing endangered whales
attributes.background: They have killed endangered Fin and Blue whales. They must stop.

attributes.action: Vaccinate all children against Chickenpox
attributes.background: The last four days I have watched my two daughters scream in agony as their Chickenpox became itchy and painful. People presuppose Chickenpox is a mild infection but that is not always the case. It is about time that we eliminated this illness and added it to the childhood immunisation schedule.
attributes.additional_details:
It is assumed that Chickenpox is a mild virus that does not require vaccination. However, this is not always the case and secondary infection can result which can lead to hospital admission and even fatality. The NHS website outlines this in more clinical detail. Another important factor is the sheer anguish and suffering of those who catch it. Chickepox is very itchy and painful and most children find it extremely distressing. When a vaccine is available, would we not choose to eliminate this suffering?
In other countries such as the US and Australia, a vaccine is offered as part of the childhood immunisation schedule. Let us not let cost stop us eliminating this horrible illness once and for all.

attributes.action: Ban all cold calling by phone in the UK
attributes.background: Absolutely sick and tired of cold calls - accidents, insurance, investments, PPI
attributes.additional_details: Too numerous to note and all of UK is suffering.

attributes.action: Cut National Citizens Service funding and apply funds to schools and the NHS
attributes.background: In 2017 NCS recieved £180.5 million from the government and has proceeded to spend it on extravagant advertisements instead of the actual service. This money could be better used by schools which constantly face budget cuts and the NHS which is in desperate need of more funding.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of disposable BBQs in the UK
attributes.background:
Disposable BBQs are bad for the environment in terms of use & disposal

Are made using unsustainable materials from tropical forests in South Africa and South America
Can't be recycled
Burn the grass & typically result it scattered litter
Local residents are unable to open windows
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.hackneycitizen.co.uk/2018/03/21/hackney-council-cracks-down-bbqs-london-fields/

http://news.hackney.gov.uk/london-fields-disposable-barbecue-ban

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/3666716/Is-it-worth-it-Disposable-barbecues.html

attributes.action: Cut Overseas Aid budget by 50% & give £7bn saved to NHS, rather than more taxes.
attributes.background: UK commits to UN target that each country gives 0.7% of GNI (Gross National Income) for Overseas Aid. Only 6 (inc UK) of the 28 participants achieve target - average for all is 0.30% - (OECD 2015). UK pays c10% of total - ie £14bn of £140bn. As NHS is in need, £7bn could save it. Charity at home!
attributes.additional_details:
Source 2015 OECD.

The other 5 countries hitting the target are: Netherlands, Denmark, Luxembourg, Norway and Sweden - all relatively small economies, with positive attitudes to aid.  

The other members of the G8 seem to have an alternative attitude: USA 0.17%, Japan 0.22%, Russia 0%, Canada 0.28%, Italy 0.21%, Germany 0.52%, France 0.37%.

If we went to half of what we currently pay, we'd still be achieving 0.35%; still more than all other G8 members apart from Germany and, marginally, France.

attributes.action: Negotiate a deal to keep the UK in the Digital Single Market
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, call upon HM Government to specifically negotiate the UKs future relationship to the Digital Single Market in the final Brexit deal.  Ignoring the digital economy would put the UK’s future prosperity and thousands of jobs unnecessarily at risk.
attributes.additional_details:
The digital economy is borderless yet depends on consumer trust and business confidence. Leaving the Digital Single Market will tax that confidence in more ways than one. We ask the HM Government to start being responsible for publicly addressing:
(1) future relations to EU agencies such as ENISA and EDPB 
(2) participation in EU funded research 
(3) regulatory alignment to EU rules for telecoms (incl. free roaming), data protection, consumer rights, audio visual media services, and copyright.

attributes.action: Insist the Government give a 50% discount for Council Tax single occupants
attributes.background: At the moment single occupants get a 25% reduction in their Council Tax which is most unfair. In houses with more than one person there are more like to be dual or more incomes, so there the reduction should be 50% to single occupant earners or pensioners as they are pay 25% more on one income.

attributes.action: Encourage schools to expell students who are bullying others.
attributes.background: All across the world, students are bullied in school. However, this is increasing dramatically. Head teachers should be encouraged to expel students who are bullying other students, as the victims often do not feel safe while the bullies are around.
attributes.additional_details: Young people/students have enough school related stress to deal with such as exams and coursework. Being bullied can affect their grades, their self esteem and in a lot of cases, their lives. Schools should be encouraged to expel individuals who bully others, out of respect for the victims. Many young people do not feel safe in school due to bullying, and this must stop altogether.

attributes.action: There should be centrally funded, free, total and complete care for the elderly
attributes.background: I want to free the elderly from the huge burden of trying to fund their own care at the end of their lives.
attributes.additional_details:
I want to free the local authority from the burden of trying to fund care of the elderly when they do not have the money
I want to free the families from the burden of having to make up any shortfall in funding in order to give their loved ones the complete care they need
I want to see some meaningful return for the taxes we have paid throughout our working lives
Finally, it is the mark of a civilised nation that the state safeguards and has a duty of care towards the elderly: the most vulnerable In our society

attributes.action: Car Tax to start from the day you Tax your car and end the day you sell.
attributes.background: If someone buys a car from me mid month and they part exchange their old car they are losing out twice. This is because the new car tax is back dated to the beginning of the month, and the old car can only claim every complete month remaining!

attributes.action: Mandatory for all alcoholic beverages to display nutritional information
attributes.background: I suffer with type 1 diabetes but want to lead a normal life. Identifying the total carbohydrate content of a beer from various internet searches is difficult and unreliable. Furthmore we have a nation of growing waistbands, shouldn't the calorific content of alcohol be visible to inform consumers?

attributes.action: Change the way the dangerous dogs act is administered
attributes.background: Instead of dogs being unfairly imprisoned based on a non confirmed act of aggression, have the authorities act upon this in a timely manner to prevent stress to the animal. This stress is unjustified and an act of cruelty towards animals where the animal where there is evidence to the contrary.
attributes.additional_details: I write this based on a personal experience where a family dog has been in custody of an animal shelter based on false allegations. There is evidence to show the allegations are false yet the authorities are not acting upon this in a timely manner. The stress this causes to an animal is astronomical and should be deemed as cruelty which is unlawful. I call for the government to place a time frame on when cases are heard in court or for legislation to be brought forward to review evidence sooner.
